column4: Anyone have ideas on how I can enable cdrom in ubuntu? It doesn't seem to be detected by the kernel in dmesg
I was told that I would have to reinstall ubuntu, but if I can I would like to just install the packages needed to make the cdrom work
DasEil: No it doesn't
Do I need to reinstall ubuntu for the 5th time? I can't use the main iso because it doesn't recognize my onboard and so  a user in here told me to use the minimal install
doesn't recognize your onboard what

It doesn't recognize my onboard video geforce 7300 nforce graphics, and I was in the irc room for 2 days trying to figure it out so I had to use a cli interface and manually download all the packages and now I don't have a working cdrom
does dmesg |grep CD  give you any info on it?
nothing comes up
how about dmesg |grep DVD
nope
it's like the kernel didn't even load a cd/dvd drive
it's not even seeing it in the bios
if it's not in dmesg somewhere
it does see it in my computer bios and it was working with no problems in windows, just when I booted into ubuntu there is no drive
can you just run dmesg and find a reference to it
I can't find any references
is it usb or something?
It's a sata cd drive I believe, let me check
Incarus: Lite-On DH-20A4P-04 SuperAllwrite OEM DVD Burner - 20x DVD±R Burn, 16x DVD±R Read, 8x DVD+RW, 6x DVD-RW, 8x DVD±R DL, 12x DVD-RAM, 48x32x CD-R/RW, PATA, Black
does sudo lshw -C disk show it?
That is showing my sata 320GB hd
it sounds like this problem here http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-850397.html
